website_summaries.verdict: At $125, the Razer BlackWidow Ultimate is a competitively priced mechanical gaming keyboard in its range. We just wish Razer had done more to set this "Ultimate" edition apart from Razer's more affordable standard BlackWidow.
pros: Cherry MX Blue mechanical-key switches offer one of the most satisfying typing experiences available
backlighting helps you game in the dark
cons: Backlighting and a few spare ports don't justify the $40 premium over the non-Ultimate BlackWidow

customer_reviews.title: Quality uncertain
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now had two of this keyboard. First one did well until some mischief with a beverage. It’s replacement developed a bounce issue with the backslash early on, one press would generate normally 2-4 \ keystrokes. That later happened to the 8 as well, and now the thing seems to have given up entirely, not responding to any keystrokes. Add driver software updates that started requiring you to log into websites to configure the keyboard (seriously, I just want to type, not sign up for your free toaster) and I’m of the opinion that another make of keyboard would probably serve me best.
customer_reviews.author: Torrence Meister

customer_reviews.title: Works great, 8 years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 8 years ago and it still works to this day without issue. As with any mechanical keyboard, it requires maintenance. Take good care of it, don't let dust and particles and food crumbs get under the keys. You should be removing your keys every once in a while to do a full cleaning with dust remover and rubbing alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ogleari

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I payed around $120 for this amazing keyboard. Although I wish the back light color was adjustable, but the shade of blue it came as is really good. I have yet to have any issues with this, except that sometimes I have to reset the macros because they disappear. All the keys work, and none are pressing on other ones like some other reviews that I've read about it. I would recommend this keyboard to anyone. 5/5 stars EDIT: 7/5/15 Nearly 3 years later and keyboard still working like a charm! My only issue is that Razer software seems to be a pain sometimes. But other than that, the keyboard itself is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Banana Man

customer_reviews.title: This is the best keyboard out there
customer_reviews.text: Appearance: 5 stars Price/Performance: 4 stars Features: 3 stars Construction: 4 stars Durability: 4 stars Technical Support: 2 stars This is the best keyboard available. If you must have the best of everything and are willing to pay your second mortgage to get it done, fire away! i'm still using mine after 7 months and running. Even though the price is one of the drawbacks, goodluck finding a mechanical keyboard with cherry mx backlit keys for this price and of this quality. This is a wonderful choice! the best choice imo.. PS: Please know that the 2013 version of this keyboard has green backlit keys not blue, they changed the color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bumped up to a 4
customer_reviews.text: Right after opening the box I have discovered that the Function Key (FN) is sticking down when it is pressed. Terrible Quality Control is obvious. I should have read the negative reviews first. Other people apparently have the same problem. I doubt I will ever buy another Razer product again. I have since contacted support. They are going to ship me out a new FN key. This shouldn't even be necessary. - Update: I received my new FN key and all is well. I have bumped the review from a 1 star to 4 star since they made it right, but the fact that I had to do this prevents me from giving it a full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cogent

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it...very upset
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is uncomfortable to use. Key presses are uneven, the brightness levels are unacceptable (there is no such thing as dim), the keys themselves seem to be of poor quality sometimes hitting other keys when one is depressed. I could go on, but I don't think I need to. I just hope I'm able to return this easily to Amazon as they do have amazing customer support. I would happily replace this with the 12 year old keyboard I have in my closet. (I plan on buying a Logitech keyboard from Amazon actually.) I've had luck with one Razer product in the past and hoped this would be the same. It wasn't. I won't be buying Razer again.
customer_reviews.author: pmen123

customer_reviews.title: Once you go mechanical keyboard, you'll never go back
customer_reviews.text: A lot of reviewers have offered very detailed reviews of this product, very little I can add that they haven't covered already to great depth. I will say that I have invested in several quality keyboards, both for typing purposes and gaming, up till I purchased the Tarantula, I had loved my G15 keyboard. Everything about the Tarantula is better, more satisfying, and provides a enjoyable experience regardless what your computer use is. You might be taken aback by the price at first, but in this case, you really get a quality product for your money, you truly will not regret the extra money and it puts all those so called ergonomic keyboards to shame.
customer_reviews.author: RNCrawfordTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: A very nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It lights up, has buttons that DRIVE YOU CRAZY because your ctrl key is *not* on the lower leftmost corner piece anymore, and clicky clacks nicely. The font doesn't bother me, and a few of the utility buttons are nice even for a non gamer. I really appreciate that it lights up as I am near well blind and it makes it very easy to see even on lowest. I've had it for awhile now, and would definitely recommend it to others. No issues with any of the keys or wearing, and I work from home and used to game, so I am on it a good 100+ hours a week.
customer_reviews.author: A.E.M-V

customer_reviews.title: Hate hate hate
customer_reviews.text: Razer's terrible customer support has made me never want to purchase any Razer products again. Terrible quality cord, it's great that the keys are mechanical but whats the use if the computer can't detect it because the cord is extremely thick and poor quality. Lasted less than 4 months with a warranty still in place but company failed to honor it. Same goes for my razer mouse death adder. Garage company that forces Ad-ware onto your computer to use their devices.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for Gamers
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband (who loves PC games) and he was beyond thrilled when he got it and still loves it! The fact that it was a mechanical keyboard was the most important thing, but I also liked the fact that it has a gaming mode that disables the windows key and such things (how annoying is it to accidentally bump that key mid-raid?). It also lights up a very pretty (almost royal) blue. It's withstood tons of hours of gaming so far and is still in perfect shape. (My husband saw me writing this review while playing and gave two enthusiastic thumbs up, as well!) :)
customer_reviews.author: Aubree

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a mechanical keyed keyboard, after much review reading I decided to give this one a try. I made a good decision to try the black widow. I wanted the back lit keys for night gaming. It has some macro keys on the side but for the life of me I can not get them to do what I need. The usb and head phone jack are on the right side of the keyboard. Not a good place for some who has their mouse on the right hand side. Not crazy about the software/bloat ware that needs to be installed. I rather just have a simple keyboard. The old G15 was too big with 18 macro keys.
customer_reviews.author: Switcher

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. The back light on this keyboard is perfect with its brightness settings. On the fly Macro's and programmable Macro's are very helpful. I swear my words per minute has increased significantly. Some might complain that they do not like the sound the keys make when typing but I actually prefer it because you can hear when a key registers instead of assuming it does. Perfect for gaming, general typing, and applications you can use the macro's for. The only con is that your finger prints end up all over the keyboard due to its glossy finish.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Gave this as a gift
customer_reviews.text: The gift recipient loves the new keyboard. He had been using a old dell keyboard for years and this is a huge improvement he says. He really enjoy the 5 macro buttons which can help him in his games. The back-lit keys are a great addition for playing in a dark room. Also of course this is a mechanical keyboard and its one of the key features he loves about it. They aren't extremely sensitive and give a good tactile response when pressing down the key. Overall I recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Msmnurse1

customer_reviews.title: No issues!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard as a birthday gift for my boyfriend. He had a Razer Lycosa, and after a couple years of intense use, the WASD keys were worn down to nothing. He had been looking at this keyboard for awhile, but never talked himself into buying. I was a little hesitant about purchasing this after reading the hit-and-miss reviews on Amazon, but figured I'd take the chance. And I'm glad I did, the keyboard is flawless and he loves it! And personally, nothing beats the reliability of a classic mechanical style keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Organization Freak / Hobby Cook

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My impressions: - Good build quality, has some heft to it. - Nice key feel and the "clickiness" is not as loud as the IBM buckling spring keyboard I have. - Keys have a bit more play (feel loose) than the IBM keyboard. - Took a day or so to get used to the extra column of keys on the left hand side. - Backlighting is only on the upper half of each key, so any key with two characters will show only one in the dark. - When I put the computer into standby/sleep mode, half the time the backlighting stays on.
customer_reviews.author: Al Bundy

customer_reviews.title: razer
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other similar keyboards I had in the past, the build quality appeared to be good and I had absolutely no issues with the mechanicals some have noted. The electronics worked fine until exactly one year and one day after I received the Keyboard (+ 3 for delivery). I was working on the computer when all of a sudden the keys started flashing and when I typed, I got scrambled letters, then the backlighting failed and the unit was DEAD, may it rest in peace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It IS the ultimate keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 5 Levels of Backlighting : All Lights in working order 5 Macro keys (I play 20-40+ hours/week, haven't needed macros yet, nice option tho) Crisp tactile feedback upon key press Mechanical, much more responsive than my old Logitech and Saitek keyboards (not 'mushy' at all) Not nearly as loud as various reviews insinuated Cons: Price (Less than 1 month ownership, if it's still working great in a couple years, price will move to 'pros' category) Still louder than I wish it (refer to last line in pros)
customer_reviews.author: M. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Pro's and Con's
customer_reviews.text: Pro's-- Looks like an incredible keyboard Sounds like a real keyboard Fully Mechanical On the Fly Macro Recording 5 Fully programmable macro keys Built in Software to work with the Razer Blackwidow USB 2.0 built in to keyboard Heavy Duty wiring Headphone and Mic Jack built in Con's Keys Stick Terrible build quality Razer offers no customer support if it breaks Keys stop lighting up randomly Overpriced - $139.99 Personally, I have heard incredible things about this product and I was certain it was going to be a great buy. However, after about 2 months of use it started to fall apart. Amazon has a great warranty system so it all pays off in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard. Mostly.
customer_reviews.text: Well I've this keyboard for about eight months and I have to say its a good keyboard mostly. I have one problem though one of the lights for a key will go on and off. So I called Razer and they will fix it but I'd have to send them my keyboard which is the only one that I have and wait for them to send me a new one. So its not really worth it for a light. I really would have thought that it would have held up a little better though for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JenW

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard For Me
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of this keyboard. I also like the weight. I have had very light keyboards and have had some slight problems keeping them where I put them. This keyboard just feels so solid. This is what I remember keyboards used to be like. A positive feedback as to when you press the key or not. I have other keyboards that when you press a key, it may not actually put the character on the screen because you pressed it too lightly or too quickly. I say, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: John Barradale

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My man is a gamer and has been wanting a mechanical gaming keyboard that was back lit for quite a while. I did some research before getting this one and found the reviews to be right on. It is exactly as described and anyone who really cares a lot about the feel, look and performance of their keyboard this is a great answer. The lighting has different settings so it doesn't always have to be so distracting while still providing a visual for your keyboard. The functionality is vast, and the mechanical feel (which is a main component of why I chose this one) is really nice. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. Mechanical keyboards are certainly a step above the usual you find on the market today. You pay more for this, but the experience is much better. You will need to realize they are noisier than most and the travel on the key press is greater than some, but once you get used to these qualities you will never go back. I expect this keyboard to last me for many years without fail.
customer_reviews.author: Retiredmsg

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Satisfying, loud, and full-featured but overpriced and seemingly cheap (typical Razer, really).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard takes time to break in and then the keys become nicely adjusted to your touch. I especially bought this keyboard to use at night when people are sleeping. I can see keys easily with blue glow on dim yet the typing is loud. But I don't mind the loud. It only seems to be loud when typing with excitement (like now). Umm 5 stars because its perfectly made for a gamer who doesn't want the sheep made keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Dylon Frazah

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Brick....
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive paper weight. It lasted about a year and a half before one of their driver/firmware updates turned it into a brick. Searching the web I see many people who have had this same issue. I have not been able to find a sure fix from Razer (who never answered my email). I've tried many of posted solutions on the Internet to try and load a different firmware for this keyboard but they didn't work for me. So I have a pet keyboard.....
customer_reviews.author: Scoot65

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, old issues are non issues
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't order this because some of the reviews talk about quality or keys sticking, being too close, not working etc. I did order this and am very glad I did, the sound is great for gaming as I have a positive response and no longer mash the keys. Non of the issues mentioned above were a problem, the keys actually have a minimal gap between them. This is a great keyboard, and really great for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff the aeroETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: But the keybord it self is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: forgot what seller I got this from but I wanted the blue back lit one (as shown). But they gave me the 2013 edition witch is green. But the keybord it self is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Xanthor

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this keyboard days ago. I bought it mainly for the programmable keys. It performs very well. It was easy to program. I did so w/o reading the directions. It speaks to the Intuitiveness of the configuration tool. Also, the lighted keyboard is very helpful. Only one negative, the speaker mute button is a function key. This requires the 'FN' and F1 to be pressed together. I'd rather a one button mute control. Otherwise, it is well constructed and meets my requirements. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: just Joe

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made keyboard with special keys for gamers and a lighted keys which is great in a low light or dark room. My son bought this for gaming but I use his computer regularly and although it takes a little getting used to; the keyboard is very nice and responsive. I think this keyboard will last a long time. Well worth the money......especially for gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Lia Klobucher

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, not too loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my significant other in 2012. He loves the action of the keys while he uses the machine. It's still going strong over a year later with heavy usage. The keys are also illuminated well and not overpowering. Even being in the same room the clicking of the mechanical keys is soft enough that it is not annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Logical Lady

customer_reviews.title: Very spiffy
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have any key problems like some people but my numlock, caplock, and game mode LEDS are both faded. Feels really nice typing on it but would prefer MX reds for gaming. Pros: MX blues are really nice for typing Blue LED backlit Nice design Cons: Might be too loud for some people Lots of problems with quality control. Its a hit or miss Cherry MX blues aren't the best for gaming. It's good but not the best
customer_reviews.author: Dan Jay Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any problems out of the keys and I use them all. The only things is when playing online the clicking gets on my friends nerves but that is expected from a full switch keyboard. Love the keys and now they respond fast and I can see them even in the dark. I have it on the lowest setting and I believe it might still be a bit tooo bright but, I like darkness.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Click click
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard feels like a tank. Very heavy and solid feel. Keystrokes are loud (it's mechanical) and quick. The cable is only about 6 feet which is 3 feet too short for me but I'm making it work for right now. It takes up 2 USB slots and also allows you to plug in your headset at the keyboard. This is nice if your headset doesn't whine when not plugged in the back. I'd recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: I like the MX Cherry Blue switches on this Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After using this keyboard steadily for awhile now I have fallen in love with the cherry blue switches. My only complaint about mechanical keyboards is that they make me type slower because of the 4mm key press whereas my old hp keyboard was only just a 1-2mm so it made for faster typing, however I am more accurate with the 4mm depth. So that is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical Gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keys are hard to read even when lit, because they decided to be fancy when writing the letters on the keys, and the keys are just too bright on every setting when backlit; not to mention that the keyboard weighs in at about ten pounds. The most annoying part of all, is that the keys click so loud, that it could wake a sleeping child in another room; it did.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix1969

customer_reviews.title: Two keyboards broke within a couple months
customer_reviews.text: My first keyboard broke within a month, I sent it back to get a new one. The second keyboard then broke within a month. Rather than waste another $20 to ship it back and get another replacement that will break, I decided to cut my losses. I'd recommend getting one of the more expensive but higher quality keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Gateway Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cherry MX Blue mechanical key switches feel great! Function keys work without hassle or pop up user interfaces (volume, playback, etc.) Lighted keys a plus for those who occasionally work in the dark. Space bar is nicely balanced so that pressing it to the far sides do not cause the key to fail. Cons: As expected, louder than your traditional membrane based keyboard. Made me feel awkward using in the presence of others at first, but I am getting used to it. Bottom line: Great usable mechanical keyboard at an affordable price compared to other mechanical keyboards on the market.
customer_reviews.author: V. Zhu

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I had done a lot of research before I bought this keyboard. I was somewhat skeptical due to some of the negative reviews about the keys sticking and the overall craftmanship of this product however I needed a backlit keyboard because of my workplace and I decided to give this one a try. I can tell you that I could not be more pleased. The craftmanship is excellent. I have been using it for a month and I can't find any complaints so far. I would definately recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: hughman

customer_reviews.title: One serious flaw
customer_reviews.text: I agree with most of the "pros" I've seen in these reviews, but it has one flaw that is very bothersome: the shift functions are unlit and barely readable. Unless you've memorized the location of functions such as #,@, $, >, ?, and so on, you will have a hard time typing them with this keyboard because they are painted in dark gray on a black key. In good light conditions you may manage, but if you are mostly using the keyboard in dim or dark conditions, it's a royal pain. And since this lit keyboard would seem to be made for dark typing conditions, it makes the design flaw that much more mystifying.
customer_reviews.author: Rfaz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2015. I still use it today 10th June 2018. Never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Ekatie

customer_reviews.title: perfect product no problems
customer_reviews.text: im using the keyboard to write this review, the product has none of the problems a number have mentioned. also to mentioned i did have a question for razer and they promptly messaged me back within 24 hours so thats another thing to mention i would def and have already bought other products from razer i deffinently recommend there products.
customer_reviews.author: matty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard ..... For The Most Part
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned 2 of these keyboards. My gripe, which is minor in the grand scheme of things, is that the rubber, anti-slip pads on the bottom corners of the keyboard invariably come off. They are simply glued on and they do not hold up for long. For the price of the keyboard, this is really a disappointing oversight.
customer_reviews.author: King Neptune

customer_reviews.title: If you are a fan of the IBM clicky keyboard...
customer_reviews.text: If you have always dreamed of an IBM clicky keyboard with lights on it Razer has done it and improved on the originals. This price was a little steep and the wife even thought I was nuts until the first time that she used it for herself. Then she realized with the big deal was a where the money went.
customer_reviews.author: Brinkwink

customer_reviews.title: Still using it
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for quite a while now, and can't imagine ever going back to a regular non mechanical, non backlit keyboard without macros. There are some minor changes I wish Razer would make to the design, but as it is, it's still the best keyboard out there for general use and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: InfinitusEquitas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gaming keyboard. Keys are loud and "crunchy". One of my favorite qualities. If you want a quiet keyboard while you type this isn't the one for you. The frame of this keyboard is made from a somewhat "shiny" material which gets scuffed up and dirty easily so be prepared to clean this keyboard often.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everything on my pc and it works well. Don't forget to turn on the key lights like I did! The keyboard spacebar stuck once but it was fixed by giving it a good ol' hard hit. It can be quite loud when typing or gaming but I haven't had any bad problems in over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Ralz

customer_reviews.title: ... own words is probably one of the most genuinely nice mechanical keyboards to get started with
customer_reviews.text: The Razer BlackWidow Ultimate in my own words is probably one of the most genuinely nice mechanical keyboards to get started with. The pricing on this keyboard may be on the steeper in when it comes to standard keyboards, but it does have some nice plus's!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Cook

customer_reviews.title: Nice typing and response, but LOUD LOUD LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel and accuracy of the keyboard, but wow is it loud! I have to keep my door closed (even though I always use headphones) because the keyboard strikes are very loud. I wish I knew this before. I like the keyboard, but I don't like having to keep my door closed all the time...
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: ... this as a gift for my boyfriend and he loved it. I don't know much about gaming keyboards
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend and he loved it. I don't know much about gaming keyboards, but it was exactly what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for the mechanical keys and the appearance. Its great for gaming and just a good typing keyboard. Good back lighting and features.The keys are not that noisy as I thoght they would be.The only thing I would change would be the type face, its a little different then I'm used to but I will get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Tim
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming keyboard i've had in a long time. I had the Logitech G15, G19, Steelseries, crappy dell & hp keyboards. They are all bad. These do make a loud click noise, and i suggest you go look for a brown switch (aka black widow stealth). They do not sound as loud, but also doesn't give you the assuring resistance and sound of pressing down a key. I had both the dragon age edition (red LED), and this one (blue led). I'd say the blue one glows a tad brighter in a good way and looks better aesthetically without all those stupid front designs.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Noisy awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: This loud bugger is a joy to type on. The mechanical feel is great, and I really have noticed an increase in typing efficiency. Plus, the new Synapse software makes it really fantastic to keep my two keyboards in sync (I have one at the office and one at home, I love it so much!)
customer_reviews.author: Naxia

customer_reviews.title: My First Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short and sweet: 1. I rated its appearance as a 4/5 because of it's glossy finish. I would've preferred a matte finish instead to avoid fingerprints. 2. Price/performance is a solid 5/5. Cherry Blue switches provide excellent feedback and comfort. 3. I rated its features a 5/5. Adjustable backlighted keys, USB and audio pass-through on-the-fly macro recording, mechanical keys. 4. Construction for this keyboard receives a 5/5. No creaks or squeeks here. 5. I would say this keyboard can last for some time given the proper care and maintenance. Solid 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: dstrb3d

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great, perfect for of gamers it's sleek and stylish and of course made by razed so the price will be a little high, but buying at amazon is cheaper if your looking to buy this keyboard I've used it for about a month now and I can't see any flaws the buttons feel great, people say it makes ur character more responsive but I don't know the difference is probably barley noticinle but the buttons do feel nice, comes with macros as well for easy multi button commands. All in all a great keyboard :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Performing as expected
customer_reviews.text: This has been performing as expected. You've got to get use to the noise this keyboard generates. Cannot possibly use this type in an office environment - unless you're The Boss, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Thanks a ton!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, I spilled a latte on my identical Razer keyboard and suprisingly it works fine still, but keys are sticky and some don't click anymore. After trying to purchase one of the new Razer Chroma keyboards, the switches felt too different for me to enjoy, not to mention my whole setup has blue led lights so other keyboards with cherry blues wouldn't really cut it so you saved me!
customer_reviews.author: Shad Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Impressive keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mechanical gaming keyboard with many features. From the moment I first used the keyboard, I noticed how effortless typing was. Each key has that distinctive clicking sound, and a great feel that has become so familiar and standard to me. I also like the "piano black" finish surrounding the keys. The back-lighting not only looks awesome, but has really proved useful when typing in the dark. The only issue I encountered from this keyboard, was a sticking enter button. After removing it a couple times, and blowing under it, there was not longer an issue. Overall, this is a great keyboard that is truly a tier above others.
customer_reviews.author: Rain Field

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard overall
customer_reviews.text: Like people said, its higher quality then previous razor products (durability, design, construction). It looks nice, lights up with different brightness settings, full size standard keyboard, and its mechanical and pretty cheap. The only problem I have with it is the macro keys on the side. I use ctrl button alot along with other keys and i am so used to pressing at the far left corner--with the razor i always end up pressing the macro key instead of ctrl. Its been weeks now and im still not really used to it even when doing stuff like copy/pasting/ find shortcuts.
customer_reviews.author: Aeth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard for any gamer!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nauseous when purchasing this product because of mixed reviews I had read, but since owning one I'm glad I tried it for myself. This keyboard is reasonably loud, and I like that (It may annoy others =P), you sound like you're typing really fast as well. I have had zero problems or complaints with this keyboard, the illuminated keys are amazing, the macro buttons on the right are very helpful for gaming (and anything else!), and just the overall design, layout, and functionality of this keyboard is top notch. Kudos to Razer! It's a thumbs up from me! =) - David
customer_reviews.author: stooge213

customer_reviews.title: great key board. mecanical is the way 2 go!
customer_reviews.text: have been using keyboard a week now. works great all back lit keys work fine. keyboard heavy and the wire is super thick and doesent flex well.the mechanical keys are super nice. kinda loud if u do a lot of typing but for gaming its not that bad. worth every dollar
customer_reviews.author: chris951

customer_reviews.title: Great but..
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this keyboard. Whilst it has great performance, and plays well, with a noticable faster response speed to the g15 i used for years, there are a few minor issues i have with it. The first being that the keys are VERY loud. I expected some clicking, and, trialed my friends, but it seems the one i have is twice as loud. The main issue being the back lighting. I have several keys that grow dimmer when used and 2 keys (T and L) that have never back lit at all. So easy 5/5 on performance, but not so high on the "does everything work right" section I would still recommend it though!
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Your keyboard was how much?
customer_reviews.text: Is the question I get when I tell norms how much my keyboard cost, if they only knew what they are missing out on. This board is not only perfect for gaming but just anything that requires a keyboard. Hell, I am writing this review using it right now. The fact that it lights up blue as well (all of my electronics do) is what sold me on it. The buttons are very responsive and loud, which is awesome. The only thing that trumps this for gaming would be the Razer Nostromo.
customer_reviews.author: robert the blue blur

customer_reviews.title: the keyboard itself is amazing the configuration of the keyboard with the blue LED ...
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard itself is amazing the configuration of the keyboard with the blue LED is awesome. the macro keys helps a lot when i comes to playing video games. the LED lights in the back of the keyboard helps a lot when playing in the dark or when you cant remember where keys are. another great feature of this keyboard is the clicking of the keyboard. It reansures you that you have clicked on the right key & hear it,
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Best mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: i love the sound the keys make it is better than all the other mechanical keyboards i have tried and its backlit and it has 4 modes for the lighting! the last mode is a pulse exactly like the razor mice if you have one you know what i mean. it has a gaming button witch disables the left windows key so you don't have to worry about hitting it in the middle of a firefight. only bad this is around the keys is a glossy texture and attracts fingerprints and gets dirty fast but its easy to wipe off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Morrison

customer_reviews.title: I have been using this keyboard for a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard for a number of years now and I have not had a single issue that i can think of. It was my first mechanical keyboard and its really holding up well. About a year ago, i spilled an entire can of soda on it. Needless to say it has not been the same ever since, but thats my own fault. Even after that, i only have about 2 keys that dont work correctly. Thankfully they are on the number pad.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMatt

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard for about a year now and it still works great! This keyboard is especially good if your computer is set up in a dark lit area the blue led keys look great One con i can think of is that the shift symbols are not lit so if its really dark and you dont know every shift symbol by heart it can be hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love the mechanical keys and the back-lighting is gorgeous. One thing to notice though is that a lot of it is very prone to scratches and is a fingerprint crime scene. I would recommend this keyboard to anyone though!
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Aldea

customer_reviews.title: Feels great though.
customer_reviews.text: LED's go out in short period of time. Reliability is an issue with this keyboard. Feels great though.
customer_reviews.author: MagicMan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard so I cant really compare it to other mechanical keyboards out there. But for me, this keyboard is way better than my fifteen year old compaq keyboard. I'm not the best typer but this razer keyboard did make me type faster. Very responsive. The keys also light up so thats a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lj

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly but was wobbly
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was nice to have because of course its a Black Widow. But unfortunately, when first using this product, I would notice that the keyboard was wobbly when trying to type on it. I had to stick a tiny piece of cardboard underneath the uneven part to prevent it from wobbling. Finally I got tired of it and sold it to someone and bought a new one from Best Buy and havent had a problem with that one at all.
customer_reviews.author: jsanchez1911

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built keyboard with a good bit of heft to it! I've used the Dell QuietKey Keyboards at home and work, and this was a marked improvements over the stock items. The LED light-up is a nice touch, and the USB/Mic/Speaker inputs are a handy space-saver. It completed my quaint home office setup to more of a gaming system setup. Overall a very nicely designed and constructed product.
customer_reviews.author: Teshie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good keyboard. The only downfall is that sometimes a key on the keyboard will lock itself. What I meant, is like a letter would type itself out even when no one is touching the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: LnL

customer_reviews.title: keys will double strike
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second black widow. After about three months the keys, all of them, will double strike. Forcing you to constantly go back and correct. A real pain when entering hidden login codes. Both keyboards did this. I am looking for a replacement, and it will not be a Razor product.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Osmundsen

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the market for a mechanical keyboard for a while and finally decided to buy one. It has excellent response time compared to my previous keyboard, feels great to type on and makes a very satisfying sound. If you have a problem with the mechanical click sound, it may take a little while to get used to it but it is a very solid and sturdy keyboard. The price may look high, but it is made with quality and nothing feels cheap about its design or parts.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard. Nice feel, lots of keys, full numpad. I have had this keyboard a few months and I have had absolutely no problems with it. It has worked very well since I got it. The only concern I would have is that the USB cable is a tad short, but it makes up for it in thickness. The keyboard is mechanical, and I love to hear the click every time I press a key down. The keyboard also has macro keys which you can set to do lots of actions with a program you download off razer's website.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew123

customer_reviews.title: 3 days after I started using it the keyboard wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 days after I started using it the keyboard wouldn't connect to my computer anymore. I suspect the wire came loose some how inside the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Shikau Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: not that loud
customer_reviews.text: Keys are easier to push than I thought they would be. Back lighting is very bright if you want it 3 settings. Could have been the best Keyboard ever made if they would have put the Mic jack on the left side not next to my mouse hand Duh. I used to be the guy that said I would never buy a 100$ keyboard.but after wearing out other crap keybards Im going to save my self money in the long run. Buy this quality board if you need 1 if you dont watch to see if they fix the mic/usb to left side V2.0 then buy.
customer_reviews.author: MrRideRed

customer_reviews.title: M5 is poorly placed.
customer_reviews.text: I hate the M5 button. Every time my pinkie goes for control, I hit M5. I had to pull it.
customer_reviews.author: FlyLice

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing nothing on what kind of gaming key board to buy & I love this! I bought it as a gift for my boyfriend that I live with and we both love it!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing great action, and the click feels so good when typing. I am very pleased with the purchase. on a down side the 1M button doesnt light up at all and the 5 is dimmer but that doesn't bother me much still a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard in the world. I love the clicky sound that this keyboard makes. The lights make it easy for gaming in the dark. This keyboard is thick and sturdy. Has some weight to it. I love the blue and the clicky. Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.author: TheUnnamedDemon

customer_reviews.title: I'm madly in love with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. Its a great solid keyboard. With beautiful back lighting. The feel of it is amazing. Its tactile, and clicky and everything I've ever wanted. Built in USB ports for the win.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay McMuffin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely heavy, quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I received a keyboard with a broken spacebar. Also, be warned, this keyboard is much heavier than the one you're using now, it's several pounds. Update 10/2011: The replacement keyboard works fine. The small rubber footings at the bottom come off regularly, and I expect them not to last, but they're shallow enough that it's not much of a thing. The backlighting is quite nice and the keys really do feel great. I had put the review at 3 stars, but have upped it to 4 after experiencing Razer's no-nonsense prompt support. Also, do not use this keyboard with a KVM. You may experience anything from dropped keypresses to repeats, to the device itself not registering on switch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Led lights.
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked great. After 1 week 3 of the led lights went out(2,H, and I). Then 2 more that seemed to go off and come back on here and there. Other than the faulty led lights the keyboard functioned great. So if you're buying this keyboard be prepared to play the quality control lottery. (Seems to be what you have to do with most Razer products).
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Best mechanical keyboard i've owned
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a bad product from razer. This mechanical keyboard with individual led keys is great. I would recommend getting a warranty with such an expensive keyboard. I use mine everyday. Each key font was laser etched and when my friends come over they think i have an amazing gaming setup. My words per minute also increased. Im never disappointed with razer or astro gaming product. Very professional packaging. Very great product.
customer_reviews.author: meow

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard, so I can't say its better or worse than the other ones out there, but I can say this: if you like these types of keyboards then you will have no problems with this one
customer_reviews.author: Bikran Sandhu

customer_reviews.title: great item but it's only for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The letters, which look cool, are a font that is kind of nontraditional (which I don't like). Weird to look at because of the tone of blue that it glows. I wish I got the red one (dragon age keyboard). It's just a bit dizzying to look at in a dark room... which is kind of the point. Terribly noisy (I don't really care but many gamers might). It's hard to type on, but a great gaming board. Haven't dealt with customer service yet.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I Absoulutely adore it.
customer_reviews.text: Recently I bought this keyboard to replace my logitech g19 and I have to say it is much better, in terms of looks, the performance however is about the same, except the black widow has cherry blue key switches and the g19 does not, I strongly recommend this keyboard for serious gamers, but if you compete, sorry macro keyboards are not allowed in competition, if you are a hardcore gamer or video editor you should strongly consider this key board.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The key spacing is odd at first if you're used to a normal keyboard. Once I got the hang of it, my fingers glide to where they need to be and I do well.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Gross II

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, just a little too complicated for me to realize its full potential
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far. Great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 2 years so far. Still no problems at all with it. I just wish the keys weren't so loud. But that's literally the only thing I can think of when I try to think of cons. I'm also not a big fan of Razer's software....
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: QA should be top-notch for a product like this, but it isn't
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mechanical keyboard and decided on this one. Like many, I was disappointed to find the "c" key rarely worked when I touched it. Amazon was great about taking it back, but I'd rather go with a brand that cares more about quality than Razer... replacing it with a Das Keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Cory J. Steeley

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: have had it since 2012 and so far everything still works great. Seems to be that Razer simply make good quality items.
customer_reviews.author: g dean

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard for about 10 months until the space bar stopped working. Went through the RMA process but didn't end up sending back the keyboard due to ridiculousness shipping costs (due to length of the keyboard which won't fit into a standard long flat box) that Razer won't cover. Going to go ahead and just buy a new keyboard from a more reliable company.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very noisy can hear the key board clicks all through the house. It's set up good though and my son likes it
customer_reviews.author: D. Huston

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great Keyboard Really Soft and Loud Keys make lots of clicking sound which can annoy people but works great for gaming
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because I was looking for a flashy, gamer keyboard. This one is great because it isn't the most expensive mechanical keyboard out there, but does the job just as well. I haven't had any problems out of the box or till now. I'm enjoying it and hopefully will enjoy it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Adience

customer_reviews.title: Black Widow Ultimate
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a really good keyboard. My only issue I have with it is the loud clicking noises the keys make when you press them. Other wise it's done everything as advertise. I used to use Logitech products and over the years there stuff has kinda been going down hill. If your looking for gaming hardware, Razer is the brand to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Testsubject196

customer_reviews.title: Immense satisfaction from hitting these keys...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - I type 8.735% faster since buying this keyboard - The back-lit keys are bright enough to double as a desk lamp - The loud clicking noise provides assurance that I've successfully pressed the key Cons: - I have not encountered a single flaw after 7 months of use
customer_reviews.author: Alexei

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I have used. Superior to the "das Keyboard" for me as I prefer the slightly lesser key travel.
customer_reviews.author: jag

product_meta.title: Razer BlackWidow Ultimate Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
product_meta.description:
The RAZER RZ03-00380100-R3U1 BlackWidow Ultimate Mechanical Gaming Keyboard is the first mechanical gaming keyboard designed to pave the way for a whole new feel and accelerated gameplay. A full mechanical key infrastructure delivers distinctive tactile feedback, superior gaming-grade response and unsurpassed actions per minute with an extended lifespan of over 50 million keystrokes. Its five additional macro keys with on-the-fly recording and optimized key matrix allow you to stay in complete control of every frenzied battle as you outmaneuver your adversaries and perform back-to-back assaults.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
he Razer BlackWidow Ultimate takes you full speed into combat with a full-fledged mechanical key infrastructure delivering crisp, tactile feedback with every actuation. Bringing an entirely different feel and faster keystroke actuation to the table, this revolutionary fully backlit gaming keyboard is rounded off by its additional macro keys and unlimited on-the-fly macro recording. 


 * 



 1. Mechanical key architecture
 2. Individually backlit keys
 3. Fully programmable keys + 5 additional gaming keys
    with on-the-fly macro recording
 4. 10 Customizable software profiles with on-the-fly switching
 5. Gaming optimized key matrix for minimized ghosting
 6. Easy access media keys
 7. Additional USB Port
 8. Earphone-Out and Microphone-In Jacks

 * Full mechanical keys with 50g actuation force
 * Individually backlit keys with 5 levels of lighting
 * 1000Hz Ultrapolling™ / 1ms response time
 * Programmable keys with on-the-fly macro recording
 * Gaming mode option for deactivation of the 
   Windows key
 * 10 customizable software profiles with on-the-fly 
   switching
 * 5 additional macro keys
 * Gaming optimized key matrix for minimized ghosting
 * Multi-Media Controls
 * Braided cable
 * USB-Passthrough
 * Approx. size in mm: 475(L) x 171(W) x 30(H)
 * Weight: 1.5kg





Full Mechanical Keys for Superior Tactility and Faster Response
The Razer BlackWidow’s mechanical key technology provides a distinctive tactile feedback giving you an entirely new feel to your keyboard. With its optimized actuation force of 50g and a reduced actuation distance of 2 mm, the BlackWidow’s keys allow you to actuate your commands faster than on any other standard gaming keyboard.

On-The-Fly Macro Recording & Profiles Allow Effortless Configuration
Record unlimited macros on-the-fly without having to take your eye off the game and immediately change between up to 10 profiles without the hassle of going into complex driver menus. With the simple click of two buttons you initiate and end the recording.

Individually Backlit Keys With 5 Levels of Lighting
Never miss a key in the dark with backlit keys that give you the tactical edge allowing you to launch assaults and flank your foes even under low light conditions.


 * 



 * Razer BlackWidow Ultimate Gaming Keyboard
 * Certificate of Authenticity
 * Quick Start Guide
 * Master Guide












Razer Lycosa™ Gaming Keyboard Backlight Illumination 
Non-slip rubber finish for optimum tactile comfort, fully-programmable keys with macro capability



Razer Megalodon™ Gaming Headset 7.1 Suround Sound 
The definitive headset for gamers today, utilizing next-gen technologies and a DSP system with unheard-of power

Razer Megasoma™ Professional Gaming Mat 
A hybrid of a hard and a soft mouse mat with a comfortable feel and smooth glide

Philip1.0 out of 5 stars These are REFURBS being sold at full price!Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2018Verified Purchase DO NOT BUY! The photo is of a DIFFERENT KEYBOARD than what is delivered. They are charging full price for 2014 edition refurbs, and trying to bill them as brand new 2010 Ultimates.

The 2010 Razer BlackWidow Ultimate had German-made Cherry MX blues.
When I got this one in the mail, I could immediately tell that this was NOT a 2010 version (as I was attempting to replace my old one) as soon as I tried the keys. I popped a keycap off, and saw that they were "Razer Green" switches: AKA Chinese knockoffs.

The typeface of the keycaps is also the 2014 version, not the 2010 version (you can tell by the ampersand).

Even worse, when I plugged it in the back-light was harsh electric blue; NOT the cyan/light blue of a 2010 version. What the seller did was took a 2014 edition and replaced the green lighting with blue, and it looks awful.

The cover of the keyboard was also the matte finish of the 2014 versions, instead of the glossy of the 2010 (and there were a couple scratches when I took it out of the packaging to boot).

In summary, the seller is simply taking old 2014 versions, refurbishing them, and trying to sell them as the old 2010 versions which used a far superior key switch, and even worse is trying to charge full price for them!Read more 7 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse poison5.0 out of 5 stars I have been very happy with the keyboard after using it for over a ...Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2016Verified Purchase I purchased this computer to use on my desktop computer. I have been very happy with the keyboard after using it for over a year. I love the feel of the mechanical keys as I am typing. I think the feedback is outstanding and comfortable when typing as opposed to some of the newer keyboards and laptops. Even though it takes more pressure on the keys, I believe that the feel and feedback actually improves my typing speed. The keyboard is black with a very sleek finish that looks very nice on my desk. I also really like the backlit keys. The Razer software allows you to customize some shortcuts/combos and map them to the five additional keys on the left side of the keyboard. Additionally, this unit has a USB input and audio/microphone inputs that run through the main cable to the back of the computer. Overall, this is a great keyboard for gaming or casual use. It is nice looking, easy to use, and easy to install. Definitely recommend.Read more One person found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Torrence Meister3.0 out of 5 stars Quality uncertainReviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019Verified Purchase I’ve now had two of this keyboard. First one did well until some mischief with a beverage. It’s replacement developed a bounce issue with the backslash early on, one press would generate normally 2-4 \ keystrokes. That later happened to the 8 as well, and now the thing seems to have given up entirely, not responding to any keystrokes. Add driver software updates that started requiring you to log into websites to configure the keyboard (seriously, I just want to type, not sign up for your free toaster) and I’m of the opinion that another make of keyboard would probably serve me best.Read more Helpful Comment Report abuse Live to read4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent and Impressive!Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2011Verified Purchase Let me begin by saying there is a truly fantastic and extensive review of this keyboard on the overclockerz website. I am in full agreement with every statement in that review and recommend it to anyone trying to decide whether to buy one of these keyboards.

On to my personal experiences now... I'm old enough to have begun on Alps mechanical keyboards, and hadn't realized how much I missed the tactile feedback they provide! I am a fan of this keyboard.

Pros:
- Build quality is outstanding, far superior to many Razer products. This is a heavy, solid product. The phrase "built like a tank" comes to mind.
- Tactile (and audible) feedback is also outstanding. They may initially take some getting used to if this is your first mechanical keyboard, but it felt like "coming home" to me. As another reviewer has commented, the (modified) Cherry Blue keys are ideal for normal typing. I also find them perfectly well suited to gaming, although I can only speak to World of Warcraft. I would like to see how Blues compare with (more expensive) Browns, but that is only based on theory. These keys work fine, and I really like them.
- The key contours and angles fit my hands perfectly and are very comfortable. Each key has been deliberately positioned, and I found the fit excellent. I prefer an ergonomic keyboard, but have no complaints about this straight board.
- Backlighting: As far as I know the Black Widow Ultimate is the only mechanical keyboard offering this feature. It's certainly the only one at this price point. The adjustable brightness levels should let anyone find a setting they like. The ability to use an individual light under each mechanical key (instead of the more diffuse lighting method used with a membrane keyboard) really improves the appearance over every lighted board I've owned in the past.
- Five additional "macro" keys on the left add useful functionality. Because the keyboard can be programmed with profiles that trigger depending what application is active, I can use these for gaming when playing games, and for the common "office favorite" functions found on many keyboards when I'm not playing. I have them set to open a Web browser, my e-mail client, a text editor, etc.
- The typical media control functions seen on many gaming keyboards are available using some "F" keys with an alternate function key (similar to a laptop keyboard). This helps keep an uncluttered appearance.

Cons:
- Ports are on the right side of the keyboard, which interferes with my cabled mouse. I don't know why Razer didn't locate them along the side facing away from the operator, as they have done with other keyboards? I have given up using the USB extension for now, (and see next item).
- The headphone extension cables are braided together so closely that they only reach back panel ports on the tower. Since these ports are filled by speaker plugs on my system, I still have to plug my headphones directly into the front panel ports on the tower. I have therefore given up using the headphone extensions as well. Depending on your configuration, this may not be a problem, of course.
- No N-key rollover. If you're not hard-core enough to know about or want this function, you won't miss it, although I feel a keyboard billed as "Ultimate" and "gaming" should have included it.
- No wrist rest. This is a thick board, and I did not find it comfortable to type on until I purchased a third-party solution at the local office supply store.

Subjective aspects, aka "your mileage may vary."
- Appearance is visually interesting, and as a touch typist I have found no issue with the non-standard font on the typefaces.
- Yes, the shiny surfaces attract dust and fingerprints. However: The same microfiber cloth I use to clean the monitor wipes off the keyboard just as well. Problem solved for me. Incidentally, hang on to the transparent plastic cover it was packed with and use it for a dust/impact shield when not typing.
- Software is not provided in the package and must be downloaded from the Razer website. Personally I think getting the latest drivers this way is better than loading potentially obsolete drivers from a pre-packaged CD. In my case it turned out that at least one download (drivers or firmware, don't recall) had been updated just one day before my board was delivered!
- Another reviewer pointed out that the "F" keys are offset a bit to the right of their normal locations. Even though I am a touch typist, I found I adjusted quickly.

In summary: Although perhaps not the "Ultimate" gaming keyboard possible, and even though there is room for improvement in some of the feature it provides (at least in my opinion), this is an terrific keyboard that I highly recommend. It perfectly does everything I need it to, plus adds a number of very nice to have features, and looks good while doing so. It is a great addition to the rest of my blue-lit gaming rig, and I could find no equivalent at this price point.

Perhaps the ultimate endorsement is that my spouse informed me within two days of its arrival that I had to buy another for her. She had never used a mechanical keyboard before, but became an instant convert!Read more 6 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States TOP INTERNATIONAL REVIEWS 
Philip3.0 out of 5 stars Nice keyboard - but has some issuesReviewed in Canada on November 28, 2012Verified Purchase I upgraded to the BlackWidow Ultimate from a Saitek Cyborg V5. The BlackWidow is dramatically better. It has the same typing area, but takes much less space on the desk.

The glossy black with blue looks very nice and matches well with my DeathAdder. You can also vary the intensity of the backlighting from within Synapse. The default is extremely bright, so I toned it down to match my preferences. This is a very nice option to have.

The integration with Razer's Synapse software is also very nice. When first plugging the BlackWidow into my computer, Synapse downloaded the drivers automatically, then updated the keyboard's firmware and popped up the customization menu.

The tactile sensation typing with the keys is amazing and a joy to work with. It works very well in gaming (mostly Guild Wars 2 for me) as well as for word processing.

It's still a bit flashy - so I'd probably go with something more subdued in my office at work.

UPDATE: After a couple weeks of use there's a few minor problems that have crept up. The keyboard sometimes detects the Windows key as pressed when it's not - which can be startling when you type "L" in a document and get bounced to the unlock screen. Tapping the Windows key a few times fixes the bug. Likewise, sometimes in the password field at the unlock screen the keyboard will send a constant stream of text - unplugging and plugging it back in fixes the issue.

Both these issues are fairly minor, but I expected more from a premium product.Read more Helpful Sending feedback...Thank you for your feedback.Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again Report abuse Jean-François Grenier5.0 out of 5 stars Everything that I wanted!Reviewed in Canada on January 5, 2013Verified Purchase Everything about this keyboard is like advertised.

The three brightness level for the LED are suitable for every situation. The fourth option, pulsating, is not very useful, but a nice addition nevertheless.

The keys are responsive and emit the distinctive "click" that you would want from a mechanical keyboard.

The multimedia key are kind of lacking, me coming from a Logitech S 510, with only function keys to control volume and music(play/pause, stop, previous, next track).

The software that Razer "forces" you to install and use, Synapse 2.0, is not as bad as people make it to be. Again, coming from Logitech, I have no issue using Synapse instead of Setpoint and I find them very similar in use.

The only issue I would have (that doesn't deserve to take away a star) is the headphone, microphone and usb port placement. For a right-handed like me, the headphone jack is right where my hand should be when using the mouse and I would never plug a usb key in the slot because it would stick out and restrict my movement.
For me, its not a big deal, since my computer case have plenty of usb port and front side headphone port, but I can see this being a problem to some other buyer.Read more Helpful Sending feedback...Thank you for your feedback.Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again Report abuse
